intro: Rondeletia ovandensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it a notable species for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
